meanings.definition: A unit of weight in ancient Rome, equal to about 12 ounces.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, they measured goods using the pes.
meanings.sent2: The pes was a common measure for heavy items in the past.
meanings.sent3: The pes decided the weight of the treasure chest in the historical play.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a pes on his shoulders, a weight he couldn't shake off.
meanings.sent5: The pes of responsibility rested heavily on his young shoulders.

meanings.definition: The plural of 'pe', a monetary unit of Hungary.
meanings.sent1: She exchanged her euros for Hungarian pes at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The market only accepted payment in Hungarian pes.
meanings.sent3: He found a forgotten stash of Hungarian pes in his old jacket pocket.
meanings.sent4: The value of friendship cannot be measured in Hungarian pes.
meanings.sent5: His generosity was worth more than a bag full of Hungarian pes.

meanings.definition: The plural of 'pe', a former monetary unit of Peru.
meanings.sent1: The souvenir shop only accepted payment in Peruvian pes.
meanings.sent2: She saved up all her Peruvian pes for a special occasion.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally paid with Peruvian pes instead of dollars at the market.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of Peruvian pes.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves was the only currency needed, not Peruvian pes.

meanings.definition: The plural of 'pe', a former monetary unit of the Philippines.
meanings.sent1: The street vendor preferred payment in Philippine pes.
meanings.sent2: He collected old coins, including Philippine pes, as a hobby.
meanings.sent3: She found a lucky Philippine pes on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: His words were more valuable than any amount of Philippine pes.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread was worth its weight in Philippine pes.
